alert.note: Alert for Eastern Windsor; Orange; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 5:21PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Orange and northeastern Windsor Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 520 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Strafford, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... West Fairlee, Bradford, Vershire, Corinth Corners, Topsham Four Corners, Thetford Hill State Park, Thetford Center, Corinth, Newbury, Topsham, Strafford, Newbury Village, Norwich, Thetford, Fairlee, Sharon, Tunbridge, Royalton, Chelsea and West Fairlee Center. This includes Interstate 91 between mile markers 77 and 107. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
